Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order Denying Defendant's Motion 
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to modify bail is hereby denied.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on May 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Amended Motion to Modify Bond
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond.

3:40 PM Defendant Samantha L. Jordan appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael C Turner appeared by video for Samantha L. Jordan.  Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Inducement: Yes, March 23, 2022 
Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT
With the understanding that the charges in the Information will mirror the charges in the Criminal Complaint, not guilty plea(s) entered. Jury Calendar.  Offer deadline is set for May 27, 2022 at 8:30 a.m.
Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Scheduling conference on June 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
AMENDED Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

11:11 AM  Defendant Samantha L. Jordan appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Michael Turner appeared by video for Kristine A. Jordan, Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared in person for State of Wisconsin.   Parties agree, based upon preliminary discussions, to reschedule the preliminary hearing in this matter to allow time for further investigation.  Court hears bail modification.  Attorney Turner argues for a signature bond, or alternatively a reduction of cash ($2500) stating why it is appropriate to do so.  Attorney Scarpelli argues against any modification based on the current situation.  Court finds that cash bail is warranted, but agrees to reduce the $25,000 cash bail to $10,000 cash bail, with the same bail conditions as currently in place.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond
Letter to Judge Rohrer from defendant re: bail.
Attorney Michael Turner is appointed as counsel of record.  Defendant is to reimburse the county pursuant to the standard collection practices of the Manitowoc County Clerk of Court.

Preliminary hearing on February 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

3:04 PM Defendant Kristine A. Jordan appeared by video, Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  The public defenders office has yet to find an attorney for the Defendant.  Defendant wishes to exercise her right to court appointed counsel.   Court finds good cause to extend the time limits within which to conduct a preliminary examination.  Hearing is reset.    Court asks Defendant if she wishes to wait until she has counsel to have a bail modification hearing.  Defendant elects to wait until counsel is appointed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Letter from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 02-02-22 at 3:30 p.m.

Order for Prints.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of felony child neglect causing great bodily harm.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 01-24-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.  Bail is set at $25,000.00 cash with the conditions that she have no contact with K.M.G., DOB: 12-21-21, that she maintain absolute sobriety and have no possession of any controlled substances.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
